Constellations

Multipurpose Low-Earth
Orbital System Features

  • Use of LEO to minimize information transmission delays [from IoT devices, and sensed objects] to data centers (the current systems transmit all device/system traffic to cloud computing centers).
  • Own fog computing and hierarchical information processing capacities (current systems have limited own computing power).
  • Cyber Protection of the system and its users with proprietary algorithms.
  • Cost minimization of creating/deploying and operating by using nano-satellites.
  • Possibilities of modernization and operative introduction of new services.

The payload will consist of transmitters, onboard computers, as well as navigation and positioning systems.

Key Advantages

  • Flexibility
  • Modernization by replacing individual components without violating the integrity of the system
  • Reliability (critical elements of failure excluded) and the possibility to promptly replace defective elements
  • Maximum approximation of computing power to consumers of services

Multipurpose Low-Earth
Orbital System Orbit Height

Multipurpose LEO System Usage Configurations

High-speed broadband internet delivering satellites (OneWeb, Starlink etc.)
